title: View or edit entitlement
content:
This page explains how to view or edit an entitlement record.

View or edit entitlement

  1. Click  > Plan > Company. 
  2. In the Companies dropdown, click Entitlements.
  3. Click the ID of the entitlement you want to view or edit. The entitlement record contains the following tabs:
    Tab Description
    General View and edit entitlement details, manage product instances covered under the entitlement, and add or remove delegated companies. For more information, see the "General tab" section.
    Workflow View the workflow and current phase of the entitlement. The current phase of the product model is highlighted in blue in the workflow. For information on the entitlement workflow and the procedure to change the phase, see the Entitlement workflow page.
    Entitled users Grant or remove user permissions for viewing or creating requests and viewing knowledge articles. For more information, see the "Entitled users tab" section.
    Discussions View conversations relevant to the entitlement. For more information, see the Discussions page.
    History View changes to the entitlement record. For more information, see the History page
  4. Click the tab you want to view or edit.
  5. Edit as required.
  6. Click Save on the toolbar.

General tab

The General tab has the following sections:

  • Entitlement details
  • Product instances
  • Delegated companies

Entitlement details

Field

Description

Display label

The display label for the entitlement.

Entitlement type

The entitlement type. Currently, this field has only one option: Product. A 'Product' type entitlement grants users the permissions to raise or view requests for a product.

Owner company

The company that owns the entitlement.

Contract

The contract associated with the entitlement.

Description

The description of the entitlement.

Product instances

In this section, add or remove the product instances covered by the entitlement.

Add product instance to entitlement

  1. Click Add. This displays all the product instances purchased by the company that owns the entitlement.
  2. Select the product instances that you want to add to the entitlement.
  3. Click OK.
  4. Click Save on the toolbar.  This adds the selected product instances to the Product Instances section.

Remove product instance from entitlement

  1. Click anywhere on the product instance record (except the ID) that you want to remove. The record is highlighted in grey.
  2. Click Remove. A strikethrough appears across the entire record, marking it for removal.
  3. Repeat steps 1 and 2 for all the product instances you want to remove.
  4. Click Save on the toolbar. 

Delegated companies

In this section, you can add or remove delegated companies from the entitlement.

Add delegated company to entitlement

Prerequisite:

Ensure that the company you want to add as a delegated company is already added as a related company of the owner company (the company that owns the entitlement). For the procedure to add a related company, see the "Add related company" section in the View or edit company page.

All delegated companies must share the same relationship type with the owner company. For example, if you add a company that has a Parent/Child relationship with the owner company as a delegated company, you can only add other related companies that also have a Parent/Child relationship with the owner company. You cannot add companies with a Partner, Customer, or MSP relationship in this case. Similarly, if you first add a company with a Partner relationship as a delegated company, you can only add other companies with a Partner relationship. 

To add a delegated company to the entitlement:
  1. Click Add. This displays all related companies of the owner company.
  2. Select the companies that you want to add as delegated companies.
  3. Click OK.
  4. Click Save on the toolbar. This adds the selected companies to the Delegated companies section.

Remove delegated company from entitlement

  1. Click anywhere on the delegated company record (except the ID) that you want to remove. The record is highlighted in gray.
  2. Click Remove. A strikethrough appears across the entire record, marking it for removal.
  3. Click Save on the toolbar.

Entitled users tab

In this tab, you can perform the following :

  • Grant or remove permissions for users from both the owner company and its delegated companies to view requests and knowledge articles, and to create and update requests.
  • Configure how users from owner and delegated companies interact with requests

Grant users from owner company permission to view requests and knowledge articles

  1. In the Users allowed to view requests and articles for the entitled items section, click Add. This displays users from both the owner company and the delegated companies.
  2. Select the users you want to grant permission to view requests and knowledge articles.
  3. Click OK. This adds the selected users to the Users allowed to view requests and articles for the entitled items section.
  4. Click Save on the toolbar.

Grant users from delegated company permission to view requests and knowledge articles

Prerequisite:

The user from the delegated company must be added to the Users of related companies section of the owner company. See the "Users of related companies section" section in View or Edit company.

To grant permission:

  1. In the Users allowed to view requests and articles for the entitled items section, click Add. This displays users from both the owner company and the delegated companies.
  2. Select the users you want to grant permission to view requests and knowledge articles.
  3. Click OK. This adds the selected users to the Users allowed to view requests and articles for the entitled items section.
  4. Click Save on the toolbar.

Grant users from owner company permission to create and update requests

  1. In the Users allowed to create / update requests for the entitled items section, click Add. This displays users from both the owner company and the delegated companies.
  2. Select the users you want to grant the permission to create and update requests.
  3. Click OK. This adds the selected users to the Users allowed to create / update requests for the entitled items section.
  4. Click Save on the toolbar.

Grant users from delegated company permission to create and update requests

Prerequisite:

The user from the delegated company must be added to the Users of related companies section of the owner company. See the "Users of related companies section" section in View or Edit company.

To grant permission:

  1. In the Users allowed to create / update requests for the entitled items section, click Add. This displays users from both the owner company and the delegated companies.
  2. Select the users you want to grant the permission to create and update requests.
  3. Click OK. This adds the selected users to the Users allowed to create / update requests for the entitled items section.
  4. Click Save on the toolbar.

Remove permission for user to view requests and knowledge articles

  1. In the Users allowed to view requests and articles for the entitled items section, click anywhere on the record of the user (except the ID) for whom you want to remove the permission. The record is highlighted in grey.
  2. Click Remove. A strikethrough appears across the entire record, marking it for removal.
  3. Click Save on the toolbar.

Remove permission for user to create and update requests

  1. In the Users allowed to create / update requests for the entitled items section, click anywhere on the record of the user (except the ID) for whom you want to remove the permission. The record is highlighted in grey.
  2. Click Remove. A strikethrough appears across the entire record, marking it for removal.
  3. Click Save on the toolbar.

Configure how owner and delegated users interact with requests

In the Users allowed to create / update requests for the entitled items  section, you can configure how users from the owner and delegated companies interact with requests. There are three available options. Each option may be selected by default, depending on the relationship type. If the default setup doesn’t fit your use case, you can change it. You can deselect the default option, select others, or choose multiple options as needed.

The available options are:

  • Allow delegated company users to create/update cases for their own company: This option allows users from a delegated company to create or update requests for their own company. It is selected by default when the delegated companies and the owner company have a Parent/Child relationship.
  • Allow owner company users to create/update cases for delegated company: This option allows users from the owner company to create or update requests on behalf of the delegated company. It is selected by default when the delegated companies and the owner company have an MSP relationship.
  • Allow delegated company users to create/update cases for owner company: This option allows users from a delegated company to create or update requests on behalf of the owner company. It is selected by default when the delegated companies and the owner company have a Partner relationship.

You can override these defaults. For example, if you don’t want the Allow delegated company users to create/update cases for their own company option to apply by default for the Parent/Child relationship, you can deselect it and choose a different combination that fits your scenario. You can select one, two, or all three options.

Once you've made your selections, click Save on the toolbar.
